name: Stm32-connector
body:
# STM32 connectivity 
The idea is to explore the STM32's potential in connecting devices together and linking to a PC.
I do know that Arduinos can do this stuff but they are slower and I wanted to do an ARM project outside work.

## platform
As I had but may reduce it to a maple clone as there is a pile of hardware I won't use.
### STM3210B-eval
[STM3210B-eval](http://www.farnell.com/datasheets/921249.pdf)
[software](http://www.mouser.com/ds/2/389/stmicroelectronics_cd00160683-490827.pdf)
[better datasheet and schematic](http://www.icbase.com/File/PDF/STM/STM30870802.pdf)
the processor is a STM32F103VBH6
[datasheet](http://www.st.com/web/en/resource/technical/document/datasheet/CD00161566.pdf)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
